DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Greater Than or Equal To 1000 Milligrams Enhancing Lesion and 350 Milligrams Non Enhancing Lesion Excision Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the surgeon expects to resect at least 1000 mg of tumor from enhancing tumor and at least 350 mg from non-enhancing tumor with low risk of inducing neurological injury.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Greater Than or Equal To 1000 Milligrams Enhancing Lesion And 350 Milligrams Non Enhancing Lesion Excision
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1000_A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce._An enhancing lesion is a well-demarcated area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on T1-weighted spin-echo (SE) images compared with normal-appearing, surrounding tissue following intravenous injection of a gadolinium chelate._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::350_An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._An enhancing lesion is a well-demarcated area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on T1-weighted spin-echo (SE) images compared with normal-appearing, surrounding tissue following intravenous injection of a gadolinium chelate._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Integer::1000 Milligram Enhancing Lesion And Integer::350 Negation Enhancing Lesion Excision
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1000:A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.:An enhancing lesion is a well-demarcated area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on T1-weighted spin-echo (SE) images compared with normal-appearing, surrounding tissue following intravenous injection of a gadolinium chelate.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::350:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:An enhancing lesion is a well-demarcated area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on T1-weighted spin-echo (SE) images compared with normal-appearing, surrounding tissue following intravenous injection of a gadolinium chelate.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

A well-defined area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on MRI or CT scan images compared with the normal-appearing surrounding tissues, following intravenous injection of gadolinium-based contrast material.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

A well-defined area of unequivocally increased signal intensity on MRI or CT scan images compared with the normal-appearing surrounding tissues, following intravenous injection of gadolinium-based contrast material.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription:
Created for ABTC 1301 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao. mc 2/25/2014
Moved to ABTC Context mc 4/8/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the surgeon expect to re
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the surgeon expect to resect at least 1000 mg of tumor from enhancing tumor and at least 350 mg from non-enhancing tumor with low risk of inducing neurological injury?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Heart Condition with Treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ischemic myocardial event, including  angina requiring therapy  and artery revascularization procedures

ReferenceDocuments.name: Brain Condition with Treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ischemic cerebrovascular event, including TIA and artery revascularization procedures

ReferenceDocuments.name: Treatment for Heart Condition
ReferenceDocuments.description: Requirement for inotropic support (excluding digoxin) or serious (uncontrolled) cardiac arrhythmia (including atrial flutter/fibrillation, ventricular fibrillation or ventricular tachycardia)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Heart Treatment
ReferenceDocuments.description: Placement of a pacemaker for control of rhythm

ReferenceDocuments.name: Heart Condition
ReferenceDocuments.description: New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class III or IV heart failure (See Appendix II)
